title.narrative: IR 1.3 COMMUNITY CASE MANAGEMENT

description.narrative: Intermediate Results (IR) 1.3 Community Case ManagementScale up iCCM in 19 districts and Increase the proportion of cases of Acute Respiratory Infections (ARI), diarrhoea and malaria among children under five who receive appropriate treatment from a VHT within 24 hours., which contributes to Child Health, Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Early Childhood Development, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Immunization, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Micronutrients, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved and equitable access and use of high impact reproductive, maternal and neonatal, child and adolescent health and nutrition and Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) interventions.
